I quickly learned she was likely suffering heat exhaustion and began media preparations, but when she flatlined shortly after I made the preparations, I knew I had to act fast. Immediately, I began CPR and brought her back. She was still gravely ill, so I called for an ambulance to be safe and the paramedics confirmed she'd suffered severe heat exhaustion. Text_Numeracy: I was having some unexplained chest pain, and my doctor wasn't available, so I went to Urgent Care. I explained that I was having some intermittent chest pain, and they should order an EKG and monitor until the doctor could see me, as I was slightly tachycardic. The doctor came in and said everything looked normal, and I should get an EKG to see if they needed to change my meds. I explained that I was slightly tachycardic, and they should order an EKG, and the night nurse should monitor it for a few minutes until the doctor could see if it was still elevated. EKG was ordered, and they found an elevated ST across several leads, and were able to get a cardiologist to order a Troponin. My troponin was elevated, and they moved me to the hospital. This meant they could monitor me more closely for my blood pressure dropping, and my troponin levels climbing, and could start IV meds sooner when my troponin was still climbing at hour 6. I was able to be treated with IV meds, and avoid the cath lab, as when I had another troponin checked at hour 12, it was finally dropping instead of still climbing.
